# GitHub Copilot Instructions for KITestServer

## Project Overview
KITestServer is an AI Model test server project. This repository is focused on developing and testing AI model functionality.

## Code Style and Conventions

### General Guidelines
- Write clear, maintainable, and well-documented code
- Use meaningful variable and function names
- Follow language-specific best practices
- Keep functions small and focused on a single responsibility

### Documentation
- Document all public APIs and functions
- Include inline comments for complex logic
- Keep README.md up to date with project changes
- Document setup and deployment procedures

### Testing
- Write tests for new features and bug fixes
- Ensure all tests pass before submitting pull requests
- Aim for meaningful test coverage
- Use descriptive test names that explain what is being tested

## AI/ML Specific Guidelines

### Model Development
- Document model architecture and design decisions
- Track model versions and performance metrics
- Include data preprocessing steps in documentation
- Comment on hyperparameter choices

### Testing and Validation
- Validate model inputs and outputs
- Test edge cases and boundary conditions
- Monitor for data quality issues
- Document expected behavior and limitations

## Git Workflow

### Commits
- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits focused on a single change
- Reference issue numbers when applicable

### Pull Requests
- Provide clear descriptions of changes
- Link to related issues
- Ensure CI/CD checks pass
- Request reviews from appropriate team members

## Security Considerations
- Never commit sensitive data or credentials
- Validate and sanitize all inputs
- Follow security best practices for the technology stack
- Keep dependencies up to date

## Performance
- Consider performance implications of code changes
- Optimize for both training and inference when applicable
- Profile code when performance issues are suspected
- Document performance characteristics of models

## Collaboration
- Be responsive to code review feedback
- Ask questions when requirements are unclear
- Share knowledge and help team members
- Keep communication clear and professional
